pageTitle: Family Dollar Stores (FDO) Earnings Analysis: Overstatement of income?

Costco stock prices have seen a YTD gain of over 16% while Family Dollar Stores has gained around 8%. Over a one-year period since last October the differences have been even more pronounced (see the chart to the left showing the relative performance of these two stocks against the S&P500). In the past year, the Retail-Discount Stores industry has seen a one-year return of 29.89%. Major players in this industry include Costco and Target. Today we analyze Family Dollar Stores, Inc.'s preliminary financial results for the year ended 2013-08-31 (earnings call transcript). We have also just published our Earnings Analysis of Costco titled Costco (NASDAQ:COST) Earnings Analysis: Faster Growth?}
textBeforeTable: Our analysis is based on Family Dollar Stores, Inc.'s performance over the last twelve months (unless stated otherwise). All analysis are relative to peers (peer list at the end of this post). The table below shows the preliminary results along with the recent trend for revenues, net income and returns. Download Now Bonus: Free Fundamental Analysis for Costco Wholesale Corporation. Find out if Costco’s returns are sustainable. Family Dollar Stores, Inc. (NYSE:FDO) and Costco Wholesale Corporation (NASDAQ:COST) both reported their earnings yesterday. Costco stock prices have seen a YTD gain of over 16% while Family Dollar Stores has gained around 8%. Over a one-year period since last October the differences have been even more pronounced (see the chart to the left showing the relative performance of these two stocks against the S&P500).
textAfterTable: Valuation Drivers Family Dollar Stores, Inc.'s current Price/Book of 4.9 is about average in its peer group. FDO's operating performance is higher than the average of its chosen peers (ROE of 30.6% compared to the average of 19.0%) but the market does not seem to expect higher growth relative to peers (PE of 17.9 compared to average of 18.8) but simply to maintain its relatively high rates of return. The company's asset efficiency (asset turns of 2.9x) and net profit margins of 4.3% are both average for its peer group. FDO's net margin continues to trend downward and is now similar to its five-year average net margin of 4.2%. Growth & Investment Strategy Family Dollar Stores, Inc.'s revenues have grown at about the same rate as its peers (9.7% vs. 9.7% respectively for the past three years).
